TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1105
TEI.2.document_title: John Ingram to Stephen F Austin, 05-31-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: John Ingram to Austin, May 31, 1825. Land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1105

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*John Ingram to Austin, May 31, 1825. Land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Colorado */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-31-1825">May 31, 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir*/p*
*p*I have made inquiry concerning the *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*You proposed to let me have *location_mentioned*near *person_mentioned*Mr. Williams*/person_mentioned*'s*/location_mentioned*, and have been informed by several persons well acquainted with it*/p*:
*p*They inform me that the land is of a very indifferent Quality, and almost entirely destitute of timber,—Therefore if it is not inconvenient to you I could wish to make another selection—I had rather have a place *location_mentioned*somewhere between the road, from*person_mentioned* Jackson*/person_mentioned*'s to town */location_mentioned*and the upper surveys which have been made on the *location_mentioned*Bernard*/location_mentioned*, I could wish to have it laid off in an oblong to include *location_mentioned*both sides of the creek*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*If you can suit me in this manner, will you please be so good as to let me know by *person_mentioned*Mr. Jimason*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John Ingram*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
